metadata.Title: CVE-2017-17782 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In GraphicsMagick 1.3.27a, there is a heap-based buffer over-read in ReadOneJNGImage in coders/png.c, related to oFFs chunk allocation. It was discovered that GraphicsMagick incorrectly handled certain image files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impact.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-17782` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm5
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm5
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm5
libgraphicsmagick++3 - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm5
libgraphicsmagick3 - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm5').
